oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Parole of Pvt. Joseph Smith, Co. A, 16th Tenn. Cav. Battn., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Parole of Pvt. Joseph Smith, Co. A, 16th Tennessee. Cav. Battn., CSA. The parole includes the description of the soldier: height of 5 ft 11 inches, hair dark, eyes blue, and complexion dark and was signed by Lt. Abraham. At the end of the war surrendering Confederate soldiers were provided paroles so that they might return home. The 16th Tenn. Cav. Battn. served in Gen. John C. Vaughn's command which had volunteered to escort the Confed. cabinet after the fall of Richmond.
